availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William McMurchy (Pendleton County, Kentucky, clerk and merchant)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, clerk and merchant. Ohio, native. Son of Jenette McMurchy. Married to Mattie A. Oldham McMurchy in Pendleton County on September 21, 1859. Father of Allice McMurchy. Resident in Hamilton County, Ohio, in 1850. Clerk in Hamilton County in 1860. Merchant in Pendleton County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Millcreek Township, p. 63A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Millcreek Township, p. 143.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 411B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film #000272800, p. 144.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Pendleton County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 303.
